description: Amy Purdy lost both legs below the knee to meningitis at age 19. She's now using her cred as a champion snowboarder to encourage teenagers to get vaccinated.
title: Paralympic Champion Makes The Case For Meningitis Vaccine

description: Getting basic health care to rural areas has always been difficult, and delivering specialized care even harder. One doctor is raising money to bring palliative care to patients in rural California.
title: Rural Doctor Launches Startup To Ease Pain Of Dying Patients

description: Scientists are growing mock organs made of human cells to better study diseases and help test drugs. Researchers at Johns Hopkins are working on a gut-on-a-chip.
title: Researchers Create Artificial Organs On Microchips

description: Fitness programs typically don't have much staying power. People are already saying adios to Zumba and Pilates. The cheapest and simplest routines are more likely to be keepers. Think down dog.
title: How Will You Work Out When CrossFit Is No Longer Hip?

description: It's been months since a nurse who treated Ebola patients in Africa was quarantined by New Jersey's governor upon arrival at Newark airport. But a legacy of confusion about state travel rules remains.
title: Ebola Aid Workers Still Avoiding New York And New Jersey

description: Every state offers quit lines and other aids to help smokers end the habit. Using both telephone and online aids works best, a study finds.
title: Using Both Quit Lines And Websites Helps Smokers Stop

description: In a year filled with gripping health stories, here are the ones that were the most popular with Shots readers. Think beauty pageant queens, pronouns and Ebola.
title: A Look Back At The Top 5 Shots Posts In 2014

description: With two young men dead, the Food and Drug Administration is considering banning sales to consumers of a highly concentrated form of pure caffeine. It's too easy to overdose, officials warn.
title: Potent Powdered Caffeine Raises Safety Worries

description: In negotiations over the Affordable Care Act, hospitals agreed to cuts in federal payments for uncompensated care in the expectation that millions of people would get Medicaid coverage.
title: Hospitals Win In States That Chose To Expand Medicaid

description: Everyone knows it's dangerous to drink and drive, but a lot of people still do it. Strict enforcement of traffic laws makes it less likely that people will get behind the wheel when soused.
title: Traffic Stops Persuade People To Avoid Drinking And Driving
